text: $MSFT $AAPL This seems appropriate.

$AAPL 
7.1.2021 
$131 price with a PE of 35.38
27th Jan 2021, $145 with a PE of 38.63. Thats an additional 3 Multiple in 10 trading Days. Lowest recorded price of 2021 gave Apple an evaluation of 31.45. Lowest PE recorded was 25x and certainly not ANYWHERE CLOSE to Earnings season. 

2022: 
The price has grown 48% from the march lows CURRENTLY @ 172
The PE is only 30.63. To think, that we can perhaps gain even +2 to the  multiple, it represents an advance of 12 dollars almost, setting a PT close to $184. Apple already has had a 7% correction from its ATH, while Ultra growth stocks rallied today. 

Apple commanded a PE of 25x in Jan 2020, before the printers were turned on. We can all agree Apple has a much better balance sheet since then and is ever closer to new verticals which demand a new valuation multiple. If all else fails, you can play the earnings hype. January always has a high Upper wick for Apple if you go back to past 10 monthly charts, because Apple Earnings rule the show.

$AMZN interesting stat:  Amazon spent $43 billion on R&D in 2021, vs $22 billion for $AAPL.  This is roughly twice their operating income.  They choose to prioritize growth and innovation over profits, and it’ll pay off in the long run.  Hang in there.
